sync

Class DataHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • sync.DataHandler

  • public class DataHandler
extends java.lang.Object

    A class used to synchronize data with a connected device using UDP streams

    Usage Guide:

    Instantiating
    Instantiate using the settings you need, many values can be left to their default settings. Will schedule event calls to update self
    Usage
    Use getValue and setValue to access and change the data stored, setValue will change the data which will be sent to the device automagically
    Error Handling
    setDeviceTimeoutListener can be used to alert your program when connection with the device is lost
    Author:
    millerds

    • Constructor Detail

      • DataHandler

        public DataHandler(java.lang.String[] inNames,
                   java.lang.String[] outNames,
                   int updateFrequency,
                   boolean debugPrint,
                   java.lang.String deviceIP,
                   int devicePort,
                   int hostPort)
        Start synchronizing with the device
        Parameters:
        inNames - Array of names for variables to receive from the device
        outNames - Array of names for variables to be sent to the device
        updateFrequency - Ms between updates sent to device. default is 100ms
        debugPrint - Debug print switch. default is false
        deviceIP - IP of device. Default is 192.168.1.117
        devicePort - Port for device. Default is 4545
        hostPort - Port for this computer. Default is 4550

      • setDeviceTimeoutListener

        public void setDeviceTimeoutListener(java.awt.event.ActionListener a,
                                     long timeout)
        Sets a listener for device timeout, will call a.actionPerformed(null) when it has been timeout ms since last arduino response If timeout is negative, removes any timeout listener set previously
